page.title: 11MEARNESS FARM-HOLKER MOSS.
page.content: Mearness Farm is owned by{Holker {Estates}which employs three people as farm labourers.480 acres of Holker's land is farmed by Mearness.50 acres of the land is used for{silage}and 40 acres is used for{hay.}Mearness has approxmately 1800{sheep}of which 800 are breeding ewes.350 acres of the farmland is{woodland}of mainly deciduous trees. There are several farm buildings in use at Mearness.They have a{shippon}in which to winter the sheep and there is also a{disused dairy}which contains a milk tank.The converted milk parlour can house some of the sheep.There are two main breeds of sheep,{Leicester {Cross}and{Suffolk.}The farmer marks his sheep with a red "V" for easy identification.The farm has{sheep pens for use during the lambing season.The {small cottage}is used as a farm house.
